item.title: The Harp and Celt
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
The Harp and Celt is one of the few places we haven’t eaten in Downtown Orlando, well, until recently that is. The post The Harp and Celt appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
The Harp and Celt is one of the few places we haven’t eaten in Downtown Orlando, well, until recently that is. It’s primarily a bar hidden on Magnolia near Central, but they have a pretty large menu with some Irish pub food.

We started with these eggs wrapped in sausage because, well, wouldn’t you? They were very different, but quite tasty. I had a turkey sandwich that was enormous and served with “pub chips” which were quite good. Carla had a shepherd’s pie that wasn’t too bad.

Overall, the place was pretty good and is a nice spot for Irish fare in Downtown.

The post The Harp and Celt appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
